p.This program has potential ties to profe: This program has potential ties to professional licensure or certification in the field. For more information on how this program may prepare you in that regard, please visit

li.Audition. To be accepted in to Music Edu: Audition. To be accepted in to Music Education, a student must demonstrate advanced proficiency by performing compositions representing a variety of musical periods (baroque, classical, romantic, contemporary).
li.Memorization is required for pianists an: Memorization is required for pianists and vocalists.
li.Accompanists are provided for vocalists: Accompanists are provided for vocalists only.
li.Each candidate must bring his/her own au: Each candidate must bring his/her own audition music.
li.The department will only provide large i: The department will only provide large instruments such as a tuba, string, bass, or timpani for these auditions.
li.The audition will serve as a placement e: The audition will serve as a placement exam for accepted candidates.
li.Refer to the UCF Music Department websit: Refer to the UCF Music Department website for specific audition requirements.
li.Prior to attending the first music class: Prior to attending the first music class as a music major at UCF, all students will take a keyboard placement examination to determine the appropriate level of class piano.
li.Interview. In addition to a performance: Interview. In addition to a performance audition, students must successfully complete an interview with Music Education faculty.
li.Application into the Professional Progra: Application into the Professional Program must be made at the conclusion of 45 hours of course work. Students must complete a formal application for the Professional Program. (Deadlines: February 15 for Fall semester admission and September 15 for Spring semester admission). Transfers may be admitted on an individual basis at the discretion of the Music Education faculty. To apply for the Music Education Professional Program, students must:
li.Complete 45 hours of coursework includin: Complete 45 hours of coursework including: 15 hours of General Education Program courses, EDF 2005, MUT 2126, first semester of Performance II.
li.Have a minimum overall GPA of 2.5 and a: Have a minimum overall GPA of 2.5 and a grade of "C" (2.0) or better in each performance, education, and music education course.
li.Have on file in the University admission: Have on file in the University admissions office passing scores on the General Knowledge Test of the Florida Teacher Competency Examination.
li.Provide satisfactory documentation and r: Provide satisfactory documentation and reflection on 15 hours of field experiences (See Music Education Coordinator for more information).
li.Demonstrate proficiency with aural skill: Demonstrate proficiency with aural skills (including the ability to match pitch with the voice) and communication skills (including the ability to write and speak effectively).
li.Complete MVK 2122, MUT 2127, and two sem: Complete MVK 2122, MUT 2127, and two semesters of Performance II.
li.(1) Students may not enroll in Performan: (1) Students may not enroll in Performance III or Professional Program courses unless all requirements for admission are satisfied.
li.(2) Students who change degree programs: (2) Students who change degree programs and select this major must adopt the most current catalog.
li.(3) Common program prerequisites are sub: (3) Common program prerequisites are subject to revision based on changes Section 1004.04, Florida Statutes, Public Accountability and State Approval for Teacher Preparation Programs, and State Board of Education Rule 6A-5.5.066, Approval of Pre-service Teacher Preparation Programs.
li.(4) This Music Education B.M.E. program: (4) This Music Education B.M.E. program has potential ties to professional licensure or certification in the field. For more information on how this program may prepare you in that regard, please visit https://apq.ucf.edu/files/Licensure-Disclosure-CAH-Music-Ed-BME-June2020.pdf
li.A cumulative minimum GPA of 3.00 based u: A cumulative minimum GPA of 3.00 based upon all courses required in the major as well as all courses taken in music is required. Failure to maintain this standard may result in program probation or dismissal. Please refer to the SPA Student Handbook (http://performingarts.cah.ucf.edu/academics/student-resources) for details on program standards.

h4.To be accepted into the Music Education: To be accepted into the Music Education Professional Program students must:

courseSection0.text:
This program has potential ties to professional licensure or certification in the field. For more information on how this program may prepare you in that regard, please visit
https://apq.ucf.edu/files/Licensure-Disclosure-CAH-Music-Ed-BME.pdf
Admission Requirements
Admission Requirements - Music Education
Audition. To be accepted in to Music Education, a student must demonstrate advanced proficiency by performing compositions representing a variety of musical periods (baroque, classical, romantic, contemporary).
Memorization is required for pianists and vocalists.
Accompanists are provided for vocalists only.
Each candidate must bring his/her own audition music.
The department will only provide large instruments such as a tuba, string, bass, or timpani for these auditions.
The audition will serve as a placement exam for accepted candidates.
Refer to the UCF Music Department website for specific audition requirements.
Prior to attending the first music class as a music major at UCF, all students will take a keyboard placement examination to determine the appropriate level of class piano.
Interview. In addition to a performance audition, students must successfully complete an interview with Music Education faculty.
Admission Requirements - Professional Program
Application into the Professional Program must be made at the conclusion of 45 hours of course work. Students must complete a formal application for the Professional Program. (Deadlines: February 15 for Fall semester admission and September 15 for Spring semester admission). Transfers may be admitted on an individual basis at the discretion of the Music Education faculty. To apply for the Music Education Professional Program, students must:
Complete 45 hours of coursework including: 15 hours of General Education Program courses, EDF 2005, MUT 2126, first semester of Performance II.
Have a minimum overall GPA of 2.5 and a grade of "C" (2.0) or better in each performance, education, and music education course.
Have on file in the University admissions office passing scores on the General Knowledge Test of the Florida Teacher Competency Examination.
Provide satisfactory documentation and reflection on 15 hours of field experiences (See Music Education Coordinator for more information).
To be accepted into the Music Education Professional Program students must:
Demonstrate proficiency with aural skills (including the ability to match pitch with the voice) and communication skills (including the ability to write and speak effectively).
Complete MVK 2122, MUT 2127, and two semesters of Performance II.
Notes:
(1) Students may not enroll in Performance III or Professional Program courses unless all requirements for admission are satisfied.
(2) Students who change degree programs and select this major must adopt the most current catalog.
(3) Common program prerequisites are subject to revision based on changes Section 1004.04, Florida Statutes, Public Accountability and State Approval for Teacher Preparation Programs, and State Board of Education Rule 6A-5.5.066, Approval of Pre-service Teacher Preparation Programs.
(4) This Music Education B.M.E. program has potential ties to professional licensure or certification in the field. For more information on how this program may prepare you in that regard, please visit https://apq.ucf.edu/files/Licensure-Disclosure-CAH-Music-Ed-BME-June2020.pdf
Degree Requirements
A cumulative minimum GPA of 3.00 based upon all courses required in the major as well as all courses taken in music is required. Failure to maintain this standard may result in program probation or dismissal. Please refer to the SPA Student Handbook (http://performingarts.cah.ucf.edu/academics/student-resources) for details on program standards.

p.Two years of foreign language in high sc: Two years of foreign language in high school or one year of foreign language in college (or equivalent proficiency exam) prior to graduation.

li.Music Education Specialty Area Courses a: Music Education Specialty Area Courses and Professional Program Courses
li.MUG 3302 - Instrumental Conducting and M: MUG 3302 - Instrumental Conducting and Materials Credit Hours: VAR
li.MUE 4332 - Secondary Instrumental Method: MUE 4332 - Secondary Instrumental Methods I Credit Hours: 3
li.MUE 4337 - Secondary Instrumental Method: MUE 4337 - Secondary Instrumental Methods II Credit Hours: 3
li.MUE 4943 - Music Internship II Credit Ho: MUE 4943 - Music Internship II Credit Hours: 12
li.MUE 2450 - Woodwind Techniques I Credit: MUE 2450 - Woodwind Techniques I Credit Hours: 1
li.MUE 3451 - Woodwind Techniques II Credit: MUE 3451 - Woodwind Techniques II Credit Hours: 1
li.MUE 3461 - Brass Techniques II Credit Ho: MUE 3461 - Brass Techniques II Credit Hours: 1
li.MUS 1250 - IPA for Singers Credit Hours:: MUS 1250 - IPA for Singers Credit Hours: 1
li.MUG 3202 - Choral Conducting and Materia: MUG 3202 - Choral Conducting and Materials Credit Hours: VAR
li.MUE 4331 - Secondary Choral Methods I Cr: MUE 4331 - Secondary Choral Methods I Credit Hours: 3
li.MUE 4335 - Secondary Choral Methods II C: MUE 4335 - Secondary Choral Methods II Credit Hours: 3
li.MUE 4393 - Music and Students with Speci: MUE 4393 - Music and Students with Special Needs Credit Hours: 2
li.MUE 3353 - General Music Literature and: MUE 3353 - General Music Literature and Techniques Credit Hours: 2
li.MUG 3X02 - Choral or Instrumental Conduc: MUG 3X02 - Choral or Instrumental Conducting and Materials Credit Hours: 2
li.Two years of foreign language in high sc: Two years of foreign language in high school or one year of foreign language in college (or equivalent proficiency exam) prior to graduation.
li.Have on file passing scores on all 4 par: Have on file passing scores on all 4 parts of the Florida Teacher Certification General Knowledge Test (no alternatives or waivers will be accepted).
li.Achieve a \"C\" or better in all prerequ: Achieve a "C" or better in all prerequisite methods/ specialization courses
li.Complete a formal application for Intern: Complete a formal application for Internship I online (Deadlines: February 15 for fall semester and September 15 for spring semester).
li.Current enrollment in or completion of P: Current enrollment in or completion of Performance III (first semester).
li.Completion of Music Education prerequisi: Completion of Music Education prerequisites and Education Core Requirements.
li.Completion of 30 semester hours of Gener: Completion of 30 semester hours of General Education and Common Program courses.
li.Completion of all Specialty Area courses: Completion of all Specialty Area courses except Secondary Methods II (MUE 433X) and Music Internship II (MUE 4943).
li.Possess minimum professional preparation: Possess minimum professional preparation GPA of 2.5.
li.Internship I: Students are assigned to a: Internship I: Students are assigned to a school with certified Supervising Teachers under the direction of a University Coordinator. During the semester, students spend two full days per week (Tuesday and Thursday) in assigned schools with half the time in an Elementary setting and half in a Secondary school setting. Students are expected to provide their own transportation to assigned locations.
li.Completion of all admission requirements: Completion of all admission requirements for Internship I (see above).
li.Completion of Performance III and any as: Completion of Performance III and any associated recital (students may not perform a recital during Internship II).
li.Completion of all music methods and tech: Completion of all music methods and techniques courses.
li.Completion of all General Education and: Completion of all General Education and Common Program courses.
li.Internship II: Students are assigned to: Internship II: Students are assigned to a school with certified Supervising Teachers under the direction of a University Coordinator five days a week for the entire semester, normally during the student's last semester. Students are permitted to enroll in other classes only with the consent of the departmental advisor. Students are expected to provide their own transportation to assigned locations.
li.Note: Contact the Music Education Adviso: Note: Contact the Music Education Advisor for details.
li.Students should register to take the Gen: Students should register to take the General Knowledge Test of the Florida Teaching Certification Examination (FTCE) before the third semester of enrollment at UCF. (See http://www.fl.nesinc.com/ for test information).
li.Electronic Portfolio (MUE 4791). Student: Electronic Portfolio (MUE 4791). Students will develop an electronic portfolio while enrolled in upper division education courses and Internship II (MUE 4943). The portfolio requires demonstration of professional growth, reflection, and proficiency in the 12 Florida Educator Accomplished Practices. Consult with the Music Education Advisor for specific information regarding portfolio construction.
li.Selected from University Chorus, Women's: Selected from University Chorus, Women's Chorus, Symphony Orchestra, Concert Band, and Wind Ensemble. Four hours of Jazz Lab or one hour of Marching Band may be used to fulfill Major Ensemble requirements.
li.Students whose primary instrument is a w: Students whose primary instrument is a wind instrument must audition for Wind Ensemble whenever it is offered.
li.Ensemble assignment is by the Ensemble d: Ensemble assignment is by the Ensemble directors in consultation with the applied faculty.
li.Transfer students must take Major Ensemb: Transfer students must take Major Ensemble during each of their remaining semesters, except when enrolled in Internship II.
li.Native UCF students must take each Major: Native UCF students must take each Major Ensemble credit in separate semesters.
li.Students enrolled in a Performance cours: Students enrolled in a Performance course must concurrently enrolled in an appropriate major ensemble if accepted.
li.Students must complete a faculty-approve: Students must complete a faculty-approved public recital fulfilled by MUS 3953. Recitals are normally performed while concurrently enrolled in the second semester of Performance III.
li.Attendance at all Music Education Forums: Attendance at all Music Education Forums (except during Internship I and II) is expected
li.Students are expected to be in K-12 scho: Students are expected to be in K-12 schools each semester. Prior to internship experiences, students are expected to observe, assist, and teach in variety of grade levels and settings (e.g., urban, suburban, general, choral, instrumental). Students are expected to maintain a record of and reflections on all field experiences as this will be required for the Music Education Proficiency Examination.
li.Signature Experience requirement is met: Signature Experience requirement is met by successful completion of the following course(s):
li.MUE 3942 - Music Internship I Credit Hou: MUE 3942 - Music Internship I Credit Hours: 3
li.Have on file passing scores for the Gene: Have on file passing scores for the General Knowledge, Professional Education, and Subject Area subtests of the Florida Teacher Certification Examination. (See for specific test information)
li.A minimum GPA of 2.5 is required in all: A minimum GPA of 2.5 is required in all courses within the major.
li.A grade of \"C\" (2.0) or better in each: A grade of "C" (2.0) or better in each performance and music education course.
li.Departmental Residency Requirement: at l: Departmental Residency Requirement: at least 25 hours must be taken from the UCF Music Department. In addition, music education students must complete their last two semesters of required performance, recital, and Internship II while attending UCF.
li.42 semester hours of upper division cred: 42 semester hours of upper division credit completed
li.60 semester hours earned after CLEP awar: 60 semester hours earned after CLEP awarded
li.30 of the last 39 hours of course work m: 30 of the last 39 hours of course work must be completed in residency at UCF.
li.A maximum of 45 hours of extension, corr: A maximum of 45 hours of extension, correspondence, CLEP, Credit by Exam, and Armed Forces credits permitted.
li.Complete the General Education Program,: Complete the General Education Program, the Gordon Rule, and nine hours of Summer credit.
li.Students interested in completing Honors: Students interested in completing Honors in the Major should contact their program advisor. More information about Honors in the Major can be found at http://research.honors.ucf.edu/honors-in-the-Major.
li.Consult with the music education advisor: Consult with the music education advisor for course selection
li.Students transferring to UCF must pass a: Students transferring to UCF must pass an audition and interview in order to be accepted into the music education program (See Admissions Requirements above).
li.Lower division courses do not substitute: Lower division courses do not substitute for upper division courses.
li.Courses transferred from private and out: Courses transferred from private and out-of-state schools must be evaluated for equivalency credit. The student must provide all supporting information.
li.NOTE: Education majors are required to t: NOTE: Education majors are required to take six hours (in addition to EDF 2085) that have an international or diversity focus. While native UCF students complete this requirement as part of the GEP, transfer students must take appropriate courses that have been so designated by their previous institution.
li.Program Academic Learning Compacts (stud: Program Academic Learning Compacts (student learning outcomes) for undergraduate programs are located at: http://www.oeas.ucf.edu/alc/academic_learning_compacts.htm
li.Take General Knowledge Test after spring: Take General Knowledge Test after spring semester of Freshman Year.
li.Apply for Professional Program after spr: Apply for Professional Program after spring semester of Sophomore year.
li.Take PET and Music Examination of FTCE a: Take PET and Music Examination of FTCE after fall semester of Senior year.
li.As indicated in the Plan of Study, all 3: As indicated in the Plan of Study, all 3 remaining GEP classes will be taken during the summer semester of the Senior year.
li.MUT 1121 - Music Theory and Musicianship: MUT 1121 - Music Theory and Musicianship I Credit Hours: 4
li.MUE 2040 - Introduction to Music Educati: MUE 2040 - Introduction to Music Education Credit Hours: 3
li.MUL 2720 - Music of the World Credit Hou: MUL 2720 - Music of the World Credit Hours: 3
li.MUT 1122 - Music Theory and Musicianship: MUT 1122 - Music Theory and Musicianship II Credit Hours: 4
li.EDF 2085 - Introduction to Diversity for: EDF 2085 - Introduction to Diversity for Educators Credit Hours: 3
li.MUT 2126 - Music Theory and Musicianship: MUT 2126 - Music Theory and Musicianship III Credit Hours: 4
li.MUH 3633 - Music in the United States Cr: MUH 3633 - Music in the United States Credit Hours: 3
li.MUE 4311 - Elementary School Music Metho: MUE 4311 - Elementary School Music Methods Credit Hours: 2
li.MUT 2127 - Music Theory and Musicianship: MUT 2127 - Music Theory and Musicianship IV Credit Hours: 4
li.MUH 3211 - Music History and Literature: MUH 3211 - Music History and Literature I Credit Hours: 3
li.MUE 3693 - Technology in Music Education: MUE 3693 - Technology in Music Education Credit Hours: 3
li.MVK 2122 - Class Piano IV Credit Hours:: MVK 2122 - Class Piano IV Credit Hours: 1
li.MUH 3212 - Music History and Literature: MUH 3212 - Music History and Literature II Credit Hours: 3
li.TSL 4080 - Theory and Practice of Teachi: TSL 4080 - Theory and Practice of Teaching ESOL Students in Schools Credit Hours: 3
li.MUE 3333 - Music Learning Theory and Ass: MUE 3333 - Music Learning Theory and Assessment Credit Hours: 3
li.EDF 4603 - Analysis and Application of E: EDF 4603 - Analysis and Application of Ethical, Legal, and Safety Issues in Schools Credit Hours: 3
li.MUS 3953 - Recital Performance I Credit: MUS 3953 - Recital Performance I Credit Hours: 0
li.RED 4043 - Content Reading in Kindergart: RED 4043 - Content Reading in Kindergarten through Grade 12 Credit Hours: 3
li.EDG 4410 - Teaching Strategies and Class: EDG 4410 - Teaching Strategies and Classroom Management Credit Hours: 3
li.MUG 3X02 - Choral or Instrumental Conduc: MUG 3X02 - Choral or Instrumental Conducting Credit Hours: 2

h4.Admission to Internship I will be grante: Admission to Internship I will be granted to students who meet the following requirements:

courseSection3.text:
Foreign Language Requirements

Admissions
Two years of foreign language in high school or one year of foreign language in college (or equivalent proficiency exam) prior to graduation.
Graduation
None

courseSection4.text:
Additional Requirements

Admission to Internship I will be granted to students who meet the following requirements:
Have on file passing scores on all 4 parts of the Florida Teacher Certification General Knowledge Test (no alternatives or waivers will be accepted).
Possess minimum overall GPA of 2.5
Possess minimum specialization GPA of 2.5
Achieve a "C" or better in all prerequisite methods/ specialization courses
Complete a formal application for Internship I online (Deadlines: February 15 for fall semester and September 15 for spring semester).
Current enrollment in or completion of Performance III (first semester).
Completion of Music Education prerequisites and Education Core Requirements.
Completion of 30 semester hours of General Education and Common Program courses.
Completion of all Specialty Area courses except Secondary Methods II (MUE 433X) and Music Internship II (MUE 4943).
Possess minimum professional preparation GPA of 2.5.
Internship I: Students are assigned to a school with certified Supervising Teachers under the direction of a University Coordinator. During the semester, students spend two full days per week (Tuesday and Thursday) in assigned schools with half the time in an Elementary setting and half in a Secondary school setting. Students are expected to provide their own transportation to assigned locations.
Admission to Internship II will be granted to students who meet the following requirements:
Completion of all admission requirements for Internship I (see above).
Completion of Performance III and any associated recital (students may not perform a recital during Internship II).
Completion of all music methods and techniques courses.
Completion of all General Education and Common Program courses.
Internship II: Students are assigned to a school with certified Supervising Teachers under the direction of a University Coordinator five days a week for the entire semester, normally during the student's last semester. Students are permitted to enroll in other classes only with the consent of the departmental advisor. Students are expected to provide their own transportation to assigned locations.
Special Non-Course Requirements
Note: Contact the Music Education Advisor for details.
Students should register to take the General Knowledge Test of the Florida Teaching Certification Examination (FTCE) before the third semester of enrollment at UCF. (See http://www.fl.nesinc.com/ for test information).
Electronic Portfolio (MUE 4791). Students will develop an electronic portfolio while enrolled in upper division education courses and Internship II (MUE 4943). The portfolio requires demonstration of professional growth, reflection, and proficiency in the 12 Florida Educator Accomplished Practices. Consult with the Music Education Advisor for specific information regarding portfolio construction.
Ensemble Participation
Selected from University Chorus, Women's Chorus, Symphony Orchestra, Concert Band, and Wind Ensemble. Four hours of Jazz Lab or one hour of Marching Band may be used to fulfill Major Ensemble requirements.
Students whose primary instrument is a wind instrument must audition for Wind Ensemble whenever it is offered.
Ensemble assignment is by the Ensemble directors in consultation with the applied faculty.
Transfer students must take Major Ensemble during each of their remaining semesters, except when enrolled in Internship II.
Native UCF students must take each Major Ensemble credit in separate semesters.
Students enrolled in a Performance course must concurrently enrolled in an appropriate major ensemble if accepted.
Recitals
Students must complete a faculty-approved public recital fulfilled by MUS 3953. Recitals are normally performed while concurrently enrolled in the second semester of Performance III.
Music Education Forums
Attendance at all Music Education Forums (except during Internship I and II) is expected
Public School Partnerships
Students are expected to be in K-12 schools each semester. Prior to internship experiences, students are expected to observe, assist, and teach in variety of grade levels and settings (e.g., urban, suburban, general, choral, instrumental). Students are expected to maintain a record of and reflections on all field experiences as this will be required for the Music Education Proficiency Examination.
Signature Experience
Signature Experience requirement is met by successful completion of the following course(s):

MUE 3942 - Music Internship I Credit Hours: 3

Required Minors

None

courseSection5.text:
Departmental Exit Requirements

Have on file passing scores for the General Knowledge, Professional Education, and Subject Area subtests of the Florida Teacher Certification Examination. (See for specific test information)
A minimum GPA of 2.5 is required in all courses within the major.
A grade of "C" (2.0) or better in each performance and music education course.
Departmental Residency Requirement: at least 25 hours must be taken from the UCF Music Department. In addition, music education students must complete their last two semesters of required performance, recital, and Internship II while attending UCF.

courseSection6.text:
University Minimum Exit Requirements

A 2.0 UCF GPA
42 semester hours of upper division credit completed
60 semester hours earned after CLEP awarded
30 of the last 39 hours of course work must be completed in residency at UCF.
A maximum of 45 hours of extension, correspondence, CLEP, Credit by Exam, and Armed Forces credits permitted.
Complete the General Education Program, the Gordon Rule, and nine hours of Summer credit.

courseSection8.text:
Additional Information

Honors In Major
Students interested in completing Honors in the Major should contact their program advisor. More information about Honors in the Major can be found at http://research.honors.ucf.edu/honors-in-the-Major.
Related Programs
Music (B.A.)
Theatre Studies (B.A.)
Certificates
Florida Teaching Certification: Music K-12
Related Minors
Music Minor
Theatre Minor
Advising Notes
Consult with the music education advisor for course selection
Transfer Notes
Students transferring to UCF must pass an audition and interview in order to be accepted into the music education program (See Admissions Requirements above).
Lower division courses do not substitute for upper division courses.
Courses transferred from private and out-of-state schools must be evaluated for equivalency credit. The student must provide all supporting information.
NOTE: Education majors are required to take six hours (in addition to EDF 2085) that have an international or diversity focus. While native UCF students complete this requirement as part of the GEP, transfer students must take appropriate courses that have been so designated by their previous institution.
Acceptable Substitutes for Transfer Courses
None
Program Academic Learning Compacts
Program Academic Learning Compacts (student learning outcomes) for undergraduate programs are located at: http://www.oeas.ucf.edu/alc/academic_learning_compacts.htm
Equipment Fees
Part-Time Student: $45 per term
Full-Time Student: $90 per term

courseSection9.text:
Plan of Study

Take General Knowledge Test after spring semester of Freshman Year.
Apply for Professional Program after spring semester of Sophomore year.
Take PET and Music Examination of FTCE after fall semester of Senior year.
As indicated in the Plan of Study, all 3 remaining GEP classes will be taken during the summer semester of the Senior year.
